result.execSummary:
The defendant Lemar C Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Lemar C Thomas

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: Waukesha County Case #15CM1039.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 09-01-2015 and/or 69 hours of Community Service to be completed by 07-29-2017.  Court must receive notice of of completion prior to due date.  Failure to pay or complete Community Service the Court orders 7 days Huber as Contempt for non-compliance with Court Order.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Work on educational opportunities.
Maintain/Obtain full time employment.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Obtain a valid river's license within 6 months.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Case #15CM1040 was Dismissed and Read into Case #15CM1039 and #15CM1041.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  30 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion
